block.p: Kirstie Robin Krall, a daughter of Ruth and Martin Krall of New York, was married last evening to Gregory Saul Joseph, a son of Barbara and Martin Joseph of Lido Beach, N.Y. Rabbi Barton Shallat officiated at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride, 28, is an associate brand manager at Kraft Foods in Tarrytown. She graduated from Dartmouth College. Her father, who works in New York, is the executive vice president and the chief legal officer of The Daily News, U.S. News & World Report and Fast Company magazines, and Applied Graphics Technologies. Her mother is a member of the New York regional executive board of the Anti-Defamation League.

Kirstie Robin Krall, a daughter of Ruth and Martin Krall of New York, was married last evening to Gregory Saul Joseph, a son of Barbara and Martin Joseph of Lido Beach, N.Y. Rabbi Barton Shallat officiated at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride, 28, is an associate brand manager at Kraft Foods in Tarrytown. She graduated from Dartmouth College. Her father, who works in New York, is the executive vice president and the chief legal officer of The Daily News, U.S. News & World Report and Fast Company magazines, and Applied Graphics Technologies. Her mother is a member of the New York regional executive board of the Anti-Defamation League.

The bridegroom, 27, is an assistant vice president of Prebon Yamane, an unstitutional brokerage firm. He works in Jersey City. He graduated from the University of Vermont. His mother is a special education teacher at the East Northport Elementary School in East Northport, N.Y. His father is a mortgage broker in New York for the Standard Federal Bank.
